Hi Tom,
Probably parsing mime.types file can help with creating even more complete regexp. Just a thought.
i.

Tom Emerson wrote:

> After looking through my crawl log for the crawl where I want HTML, I
> was still seeing a lot of bandwidth taken up downloading file
> extensions that I didn't want: tarballs, RPMs, QuickTime movies, Excel
> spreadsheets, ISO images, etc. I've tweaked the regular expression
> regexp to exclude more types:
> 
> ^.*(?i)\.(bin|dmg|iso|tar\.gz|tar\.bz2|sit|hqx|xls|qt|dvi|zip|rpm|rtf|bmp|gif|jpe?g|png|pdf|tiff?|mid|mp[2-4]|wav|avi|mov|mpe?g|ram|rm|smil|wmv|doc|ppt|swf)$
> 
> I also saw cases where .tif and .mpg were coming through, so I made
> the regexp a little more tolerant of these variations.
> 
> Share and enjoy.
> 
>     -tree
>
